=================
### Asset Liability Management (ALM) Software Request for Information (RFI)
#### Solicitation Number 2023-DB-002

The Farm Credit Canada (FCC) is seeking information from vendors who can provide a comprehensive Asset Liability Management (ALM) software solution. The selected partner will work with FCC to enhance their current system capabilities, improve strategic and tactical decision-making, and provide a leading-edge solution for risk measurement, forecasting, reporting, and analytics.

### Background
Farm Credit Canada is a federal commercial Crown corporation that provides financing, knowledge, and software solutions to its customers. As a leading agriculture and food lender, FCC has a significant loan portfolio of over $47 billion. With a strong commitment to the future of Canadian agriculture and food, FCC is eager to engage with industry leaders to explore new solutions.

### RFI Details
The RFI Reference Number is cb-4564-97675327, and it is not a call for tenders, but an opportunity for FCC to identify vendors with suitable experience and expertise for potential consideration in future opportunities. Vendors interested in receiving the RFI document should contact Dhruv Bhatt, Procurement and Vendor Manager, at procurement@fcc-fac.ca.

### RFI Schedule
The RFI has been issued on April 4, 2023, and questions from vendors will be accepted until April 18, 2023, at 2:00 PM CST (Saskatchewan time). The RFI closing date and time is May 5, 2023, at 2:00 PM CST (Saskatchewan time).

### Business Requirements
FCC is seeking a comprehensive ALM software solution that can meet the following business requirements:
* Risk measurement and forecasting
* Reporting and analytics
* Strategic and tactical decision-making
* Enhanced system capabilities

### How to Participate
Vendors who are interested in participating in this RFI should contact Dhruv Bhatt, Procurement and Vendor Manager, at procurement@fcc-fac.ca to request the RFI document. This opportunity is a precursor to potential future opportunities, and FCC is seeking to identify vendors with suitable experience and expertise.

### Note
The UN/CEFACT codelist for the Universal Standard Products and Services Code (UNSPSC) for this RFI is as follows:
* UNSPSC: 43230000, 43233700, 43233701, 84121500
* UNSPSC Description: Software, System management software, Enterprise system management software,
